text: Salah Shehade was a member of the Hamas movement and he was the leader of the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades, the military wing of Hamas, until he was killed in a airstrike by the Israel Defense Forces."Shehade was high on Israel most- wanted list" , CNN, 23 July 2002"Salah Shehade" profile, Jewish Virtual Library; accessed 21 November 2014.Yuval Yoaz, "State commission to examine civilian deaths in 2002 Shehade assassination", Haaretz, 19 September 2007Appeal to the Spanish Supreme Court , Javier Fernández Estrada, 21 September 2009. The airstrike killed 15 civilians (including 7 children) and injured around 50-150 people.Yuval Yoaz, "State commission to examine civilian deaths in 2002 Shehade assassination", Haaretz, 19 September 2007Appeal to the Spanish Supreme Court , Javier Fernández Estrada, 21 September 2009. == References == Category:Deaths by Israeli airstrikes Category:2002 deaths Category:1953 births Category:Hamas Category:Islamist insurgents Category:Hamas people
title: Salah Shehade
